reviewText: I saw this film several years ago, so my memory's a little rusty, but since there are no other reviews for "Rich, Young and Pretty" yet I'd thought I'd give a quick synopsis for those of you just browsing.Jane Powell stars as a young Texan who is taken to Paris by her father, played by Wendell Corey. While there, she runs across her mother (Danielle Darrieux) , who is working in a night club with her boyfriend (the oh-so handsome Fernando Lamas). This turns out to be a problem, since Powell had been told by her father that her mother was deceased. Oops! Hilarity ensues. I wouldn't say this film is in the first or second tier of Powell pictures ("Two Weeks with Love" and "A Date With Judy" are my faves) and it does drag a bit in spots, but Jane is always a delight to watch and it does have it's bright spots. Among them is a charming rendition of "We Never Talk Much" , a fun song I really like.You might want to check out "Rich, Young and Pretty" if you are a fan of Jane or old Technicolor musicals. Grade: B-
summary: Good fun for Jane Powell fans

reviewText: Another "cutesy" movie starring Jane Powell, who is always the perpetual fetching lass and mistress of her own genre,A wonderful voice (a true coloratura), the perfect pout -- not to mention her gorgous gams, what's not to love?She is the beautiful girl next door that you soulfully pined for but never got to kiss.Isn't there one more (at least) Jane Powell movie that Amazon has not yet presented for sale?  I think there is.  Check it out!

reviewText: I originally saw this movie when i was  youg boy,{I am now 67 years old]. This film has stayed with me all these years .The musicals of the forties and thirtys were so good,the story lines were so simple and the movies of this time were entertaining and always refered to family values.As a youg boy Jane Powell was idle,and of course I still appreaciate her to this very day. i was a bit aprehensive in purchasing this copy ,but much to my surprise I found the print very good.I am looking forward to more musicals being produced on dvd.Ken  BarrettMooroolbark Vic Australia.

reviewText: Rich, Young and Pretty is a classic romantic musical with some comedy that showcases the wonderfully talented Jane Powell along with Danielle Darrieux; Wendell Corey, a rather young Vic Damone in his film debut; Fernando Lamas (also in his film debut) and even Una Merkel! The plot moves along well with numerous musical numbers that are quite appealing and memorable; Jane Powell and others never sing a single off note and I was very impressed! The sets, choreography and cinematography all work well and the background musical score enhances the film, too.When the action starts, we quickly meet young Elizabeth Rogers (Jane Powell) and her father Jim Rogers (Wendell Corey) who live on a ranch in Texas. Elizabeth is engaged to the handsome Bob Lennart (Richard Anderson) who just can't understand why Elizabeth wants to go with her father to Paris where he has to make an important United Nations speech. Accompanying Elizabeth and her father Jim is Elizabeth's childhood nanny, Glynnie (Una Merkel).Of course, once Elizabeth, Jim and Glynnie arrive in Paris it isn't long before things get complicated. Jim never told Elizabeth the truth about her mother (his former wife)--that she was married to him after a whirlwind romance in Paris; but Marie found Texas so boring that she returned alone to Paris. Instead, Jim told Elizabeth that her mother had passed away! But when her mother, the very much still living and famous entertainer Marie Devarone (Danielle Darrieux) finds out that Elizabeth is in Paris with Jim, she just has to see and then meet Elizabeth! Elizabeth also becomes romantically involved with Andre Milan (Vic Damone), the son of one of Jim's business associates.Things gets even more complicated when Jim discovers that Marie has set her sights on getting to know Elizabeth and that Elizabeth is interested in Andre after knowing him less than a week; he thinks that nothing good will come of this.Although it may seem that I've given away too much I assure you that there's plenty more to the plot where that came from--and I won't write more to avoid giving out spoilers! I hope you watch and enjoy this film as much as I did. As I mentioned before, the musical numbers are both classic and delightful.Look also for solid performances by Marcel Dalio as Claude Duval; Jean Murat as Monsieur Henri Milan; Fernando Lamas as Marie's current love interest and cabaret partner Paul Sarnac and The Four Freshmen as a singing quartet! George and Katrin Tatar do a great Hungarian dance midway through the film.Rich, Young and Pretty is a must-have for fans of Jane Powell and other greats including Vic Damone, Fernando Lamas and Danielle Darrieux. This movie will also appeal to anyone who appreciates classic romantic musicals with some comedy thrown in for a good effect.
summary: fine romantic musical -- and even some comedy
